    • Method Detail

      • onTick

        public void onTick()
        Performed on every tick of the timer. Moves the projectiles, checks to see if the targets have been destroyed.
        Overrides:
        onTick in class javalib.impworld.World

      • onMouseClicked

        public void onMouseClicked(javalib.worldimages.Posn loc)
        Performed when the player clicks the canvas. Calls for a new projectile to be added to the screen, and increments the shot counter.
        Overrides:
        onMouseClicked in class javalib.impworld.World
        Parameters:
        loc - the location of the mouse when clicked

      • addProjectile

        public void addProjectile(double dy,
                 double dx)
        Adds a projectile to the ArrayList of projectiles. Does so given the dy and dx of the respective projectile.

      • showProjectiles

        public javalib.worldimages.WorldImage showProjectiles(java.util.ArrayList<Projectile> shots)
        Draws the projectile image for each item in the projectile ArrayList.

      • showTargets

        public javalib.worldimages.WorldImage showTargets(java.util.ArrayList<Targets> targets)
        Draws the target images for each item in the target ArrayList.

      • showPlatforms

        public javalib.worldimages.WorldImage showPlatforms(java.util.ArrayList<Platforms> platforms)
        Draws the platform images for each item in the platform ArrayList. Each platform is drawn directly beneath a target.

      • getX

        public double getX(javalib.worldimages.Posn loc)
        Calculates dx for the projectile's path. Does this based on the location of the mouse click.

      • getY

        public double getY(javalib.worldimages.Posn loc)
        Calculates dy for the projectile's path. Does this based on the location of the mouse click.

      • makeImage

        public javalib.worldimages.WorldImage makeImage()
        Draws the WorldImage for the canvas.
        Specified by:
        makeImage in class javalib.impworld.World
        Returns:
        the image that represents this world at this moment

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the canvas so the player may play another round. Canvas is reset by distributing new targets and platforms, as well as clearing the space of projectiles and resetting the shot counter.
